homeExemptions.postDeathTreatment: subject to recovery from both probate and non-probate estate assets if no protected heirs remain

recoveryTimeframes.statuteLimit: 2 years from date of death; state may initiate probate

criteria: loss of primary housing or income

incomeDisregards: incurred medical expenses may offset income

spousalProtections.jointPropertyTreatment: may be subject to recovery under expanded estate rules
additionalProtections: recovery deferred until after surviving spouse's death

administrative.agency: Washington State Health Care Authority (HCA), Office of Medicaid Eligibility and Policy

programEffectiveness.estatesPursued: probate and non-probate assets including trusts, joint accounts, and life estates

effectiveStrategies: use irrevocable Medicaid Asset Protection Trusts (MAPTs)
do not rely solely on probate avoidance tools
establish early asset transfers to avoid expanded estate inclusion
submit hardship waiver applications with proper financial documentation
